On 1/20/06, hdpoliya <haod@...> wrote:
>
> But to my knowlege, y=
our experience is against the theory of software
> engineering. We suggest =
that during developing, the testers of a
> program should not be the ones d=
eveloped it.
> I am confused.


It should be a mix of both.

Developers pro=
vide white box testing (testing with knowledge of the
implementation) and s=
imple tests of all the main features they code.

QA testers provide black b=
ox testing.   They are given functional specs and
the tests of the develope=
rs and they write their own tests from there.

The reason why you can't let=
 either group own 100% of the tests is because
they each come with their ow=
n bias/limitations:

   - Developers tend to test only what they think thei=
r software does.
   - QA testers can overlook testing tricky parts of the c=
ode because
   either the functional specs or their understanding of the co=
de is not
   exhaustive.

--
C=E9dric
